definition: The overall semantic unity of a text where ideas relate meaningfully to each other and to the central purpose

positive_examples: Despite covering many topics, the text maintains coherence through its central theme of sustainability.
The reader can follow the argument because each idea connects logically to the next.
Coherence emerges from the underlying conceptual relationships between sentences.
The text feels unified - every paragraph contributes to the main point.
negative_examples: The text uses transition words frequently.
training_hints.disambiguation: Overall meaning-level unity, not just surface-level linking
